doc.title: APPENDIX - FINANCIAL FORECASTS
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-30/BYD Q2 The price of market leadership BYD Q2 The price of market leadership_2025-08-30

passages.text: Asian Autos BYD Co Ltd Rating Outperform

Q2 was a miss. BYD posted revenue of RMB 201bn, representing \(+14\%\) yoy and \(+17.9\%\) qoq. EV & battery revenue grew \(+17.2\%\) yoy, \(+17.8\%\) qoq, while BYDE (i.e. mobile handset business) revenue was \(+3.9\%\) yoy, \(+18.6\%\) qoq. Overall gross margin stood at \(16.3\%\) , worsened vs. \(17.4\%\) in Q2 24 and \(20.1\%\) in Q1 2025. Net income arrived at RMB 6.6bn, \(- 29.4\%\) yoy, \(- 30.2\%\) qoq, and implied \(3.3\%\) net margin, vs. \(5.3\%\) in Q2 24 and \(5.5\%\) in Q1 25. Net profit per car fell to RMB 4.8k, vs. RMB 8.5k in Q2 24 and RMB 8.8k in Q1 25.

Scars of competition. BYD delivered 1.15mn EVs in Q2 25, \(+16.1\%\) yoy and \(+14.4\%\) qoq. We estimate ASP fell RMB 5k sequentially to RMB 112k, \(- 15\%\) yoy and \(- 5\%\) qoq, due to aggressive pricing. External battery shipment surged \(+500\%\) yoy and \(+140\%\) qoq, supported by key clients including XPeng (MONA) and Xiaomi. We estimate EV & battery gross margin deteriorated to \(18.7\%\) , vs. \(20.7\%\) in Q2 24 and \(23.9\%\) in Q1 25. Excluding a one- off RMB 1 bn dealer incentive, margin was about \(19.2\%\) , only slightly better. Despite a higher overseas sales mix ( \(23\%\) vs. \(11\%\) in Q2 24), margin pressure persisted. Increased promotional efforts did not achieve the anticipated volume growth. Additionally, higher capex (RMB 80bn in 1H) led to increased D&A expenses, further weighing on margins.

Overseas traction remains strong, while domestic market share shows signs of stabilizing. We maintain a constructive view on BYD, driven by its robust overseas performance. In Q2, BYD's overseas wholesale volumes surged by \(145\%\) yoy and \(25\%\) qoq. The company is well on track to hit 1mn units in overseas volumes, ahead of company's latest guidance at 800k. Retail registrations we monitor also indicate strong demand, with a \(210\%\) YoY and \(29\%\) QoQ increase. Growth is especially pronounced in Europe, including markets such as Turkey, the UK, and Spain, which experienced over \(530\%\) YoY and \(61\%\) QoQ growth, supported by the launch of PHEVs. The overseas operations remain significantly more profitable, with net profit per vehicle estimated to exceed RMB 25k. (more on page 2)

We rate BYD Outperform with price targets for 1211. HK at HK\$130.00 (old: HK\$133.00) and for 002594. CH at RMB120.00 (old: RMB122.00) based on rolled forward SOTP assumptions that correlates to 18x 1- year forward P/E (unchanged).

Domestically, BYD's EV market share improved to \(29.7\%\) in Q2 2025, compared to \(34.2\%\) in Q2 24 and \(29.1\%\) in Q1 2025. Recent retail volume trends suggest stabilization, even as pricing promotions have been scaled back. It is important to note that Q3 24 was an exceptionally strong quarter for BYD, setting a high base for comparison. Additionally, competition intensifies as peers like Geely, and Huawei introduce ADAS in the sub- RMB 200k mass market segment, exerting pressure on BYD. The company's proactive product launch strategy may help mitigate some of this competitive pressure.

Financial forecast and estimate changes: BYD is our top Outperform pick for the sector. We forecast BYD to deliver sales volume of \(5.1mn / 6.0mn\) units in 2025/2026, including \(1.0mn / 1.4mn\) units overseas. We cut our EPS forecasts to RMB 5.32/ RMB 5.94 per share for 2025/2026 on worse- than- expected margin erosion resulted from pricing competition and growth slowdown, which is offset by stronger traction of battery business. Exhibit 16 shows a summary of our estimate changes. Our latest projections for the company are attached in the appendix section. We remain Outperform rating on BYD. Our PT is lowered modestly to \(\mathsf{HK}\Phi 130.00\) (Old: \(\mathsf{HK}\Phi 133.00)\) based on SOTP method, which correlates to \(18x2026\) EPS (Unchanged).

EXHIBIT 12: BYD's share in China EV market improved modestly to 29.7% in Q2 2025 from 29.1% in Q1 2025, yet still weak comparing to 34.2% in Q2 2024. The fresh product cycles from peers (e.g. Geely Galaxy) are still weighing on BYD's market share, and we do not expect a meaningful reversal in the next a few months
2021-2025 7M: BYD sales volume by powertrain and EV market share
Source: C.A.D. and Bernstein analysis
EXHIBIT 13: BYD is tracking steady growth in overseas markets, especially in LATAM, ASEAN, and Europe; we expect PHEV exports to further fuel growth
2022-2025 6M: BYD overseas vehicle registrations by region
Source:SNE and Bernstein analysis

2022-2025 6M: BYD overseas vehicle registrations by model
Source:SNE and Bernstein analysis

EXHIBIT 15: Product pipeline of BYD: In Q2 25, BYD launched 5 new models including Tang L, Han L, Seal 06 EV and GT, Sea Lion 07 DM-i, and Fand Cheng Bao; in 2025 2H, BYD is expected to roll out Sea Lion 06, Denza D9L and Z7, Fang Cheng Bao Tai 7, Yangwang U8L, etc.

Bernstein Japan KK (サンフォード・C・バーンスタイン株式会社).

On April 1, 2024, Société Générale (SG) and AllianceBernstein, LP. (AB) completed a transaction that created a new joint venture in which their respective cash equities and research businesses operate in a new business combination. Although their respective ownership percentages in the joint venture differ between North America and the rest of the world, the creation, production and publication of research is handled collaboratively on a global basis across the two research brands, "Bernstein" and "Autonomous". Unless specifically noted otherwise, for purposes of these disclosures, references to Bernstein's "affiliates" relate to both SG and AB and their respective affiliates.

We value BYD based on SOTP valuation. For the EV business, we analysed its valuation with DCF, P/E, and EV/sales approaches. For the battery business, we valued it with DCF, P/E, and EV/EBITDA methods. For handset component and assembly business, we use current market capitalization of BYDE (285 HK, not covered) in the calculation. For semiconductor, we benchmarked against the last transaction value of BYD Semiconductor in our calculation.
We rate BYD Outperform with price target for 1211. HK at HK\$130.00 and for 002594. CH at RMB 120, based on SOTP that correlates to 18x 2026E P/E.

Key risks to our target price relate to sales volume missing expectation, issues arise with product quality and potential recalls, deteriorating competitive landscape, technological disruption, and unfavourable government policies. A- share listed stocks may be relatively more volatile than their H- share listed counterparts, and downside risks could come from Chinese government policies as China looks to control the rate of growth of its economy in general, or capital markets in particular. These policies may manifest in market rules that affect A- and H- shares differently.

The Bernstein brand rates stocks based on forecasts of relative performance for the next 12 months versus the S&P 500 for stocks listed on the U.S. and Canadian exchanges, versus the Bloomberg Europe Developed Markets Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index (EDM) for stocks listed on the European exchanges and emerging markets exchanges outside of the Asia Pacific region, versus the Bloomberg Japan Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index USD (JP) for stocks listed on the Japanese exchanges, and versus the Bloomberg Asia ex- Japan Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index (ASIAX) for stocks listed on the Asian (ex- Japan) exchanges - unless otherwise specified.
The Bernstein brand has three categories of ratings:

- Outperform: Stock will outpace the market index by more than 15 pp- Market-Perform: Stock will perform in line with the market index to within +/-15 pp- Underperform: Stock will trail the performance of the market index by more than 15 pp

Coverage Suspended: Coverage of a company under the Bernstein research brand has been suspended. Ratings and price targets are suspended temporarily, are no longer current, and should therefore not be relied upon.

Not Rated: A rating assigned when the stock cannot be accurately valued, or the performance of the company accurately predicted, at the present time. The covering analyst may continue to publish research reports on the company to update investors on events and developments.
Not Covered (NC) denotes companies that are not under coverage.

The Autonomous brand rates stocks as indicated below. As our benchmarks we use the Bloomberg Europe 500 Banks And Financial Services Index (BEBANKS) and Bloomberg Europe Dev Mkt Financials Large and Mid Cap Price Ret Index EUR (EDMFI)index for developed European banks and Payments, the Bloomberg Europe 500 Insurance Index (BEINSUR) for European insurers, the S&P 500 and S&P Financials for US banks and Payments coverage, S5LIFE for US Insurance, the S&P Insurance Select Industry (SPSIINS) for US Non-Life Insurers coverage, and the Bloomberg Emerging Markets Financials Large, Mid and Small Cap Price Return Index (EMLSF) for emerging market banks and insurers and Payments. Ratings are stated relative to the sector (not the market).
The Autonomous brand has three categories of ratings:
·Outperform (OP): Stock will outpace the relevant index by more than 10 pp
·Neutral (N): Stock will perform in line with the market index to within +/-10 pp
·Underperform (UP): Stock will trail the performance of the relevant index by more than 10 pp

Coverage Suspended: Coverage of a company under the Bernstein research brand has been suspended. Ratings and price targets are suspended temporarily, are no longer current, and should therefore not be relied upon.

Not Rated: A rating assigned when the stock cannot be accurately valued, or the performance of the company accurately predicted, at the present time. The covering analyst may continue to publish research reports on the company to update investors on events and developments.
Those denoted as 'Feature' (e.g., Feature Outperform FOP, Feature Under Outperform FUP) are our core ideas. Not Covered (NC)denotes companies that are not under coverage.
For both brands, recommendations are based on a 12-month time horizon.
